description: The community of Jacumba, in California, has been overwhelmed with migrant encampments — as many as a thousand people in dire humanitarian conditions. A few weeks ago, locals say, something changed.
title: A dip in unauthorized border crossings has left a California migrant encampment empty

description: This is the second time Trump has been ordered pay Carroll; last year he was mandated by a jury to pay $5 million for a separate instance of defamation.
title: Jury orders Trump to pay $83 million for defaming columnist E. Jean Carroll

description: The 75-year-old British monarch is doing well after undergoing a "corrective procedure" for an enlarged prostate, Queen Camilla said Friday as she left the private hospital where he was being treated.
title: King Charles III 'doing well' after scheduled prostate treatment, Queen Camilla says

description: The U.N. has announced it has launched an investigation into the allegations. The U.S., which said 12 employees were involved, said it would pause funding to UNRWA, which provides aid to Palestinians.
title: U.N. agency in Gaza fires employees over alleged involvement in Oct. 7 attack

description: After a green light from the FAA, the Max 9 is set to return to the skies. Here's what travelers need to know about the plane after a terrifying scene on an Alaska Airlines flight earlier this month.
title: Here's how to tell if your next flight is on a Boeing 737 Max 9

description: The International Court of Justice ordered Israel to ensure its military does not take actions that violate the Genocide Convention, but did not call for a cease-fire.
title: U.N. court says Gaza genocide is 'plausible,' but does not order cease-fire

description: The U.N.'s top court is issuing an interim order on the genocide case against Israel. A bipartisan Senate deal pairing border security with aid for Ukraine and Israel could fall through.
title: Up First Briefing: ICJ finds Gaza genocide case 'plausible'; bipartisan border deal

description: An elementary school in Florida, credits daily mindfulness lessons with helping students cope with stress — and turning the school around academically. The lessons are delivered through an app.
title: To help these school kids deal with trauma, mindfulness lessons over the loudspeaker

description: Scientists looked at trees to better understand the interplay between temperatures and droughts in the Western U.S. Human-caused climate change is exacerbating both.
title: 'Hot droughts' are becoming more common in the arid West, new study finds

description: The ancient extinct shark that starred in the film The Meg is thought to be the largest shark that ever swam the Earth. But there's debate over what it really looked like.
title: That giant extinct shark, Megalodon? Maybe it wasn't so mega

description: Israeli leader Benjamin Netanyahu and Hamas have a tortured relationship dating back to the 1990s. Yet at various times, the hardline policies of one have boosted the other.
title: The long and bitter relationship between Israel's Benjamin Netanyahu and Hamas

description: Scientists say gene-editing technology may eradicate a mosquito in the U.S. that spreads dengue and other diseases. Concerns remain about the possible environmental impact of bioengineered mosquitoes.
title: New gene-editing tools may help wipe out mosquito-borne diseases

description: This week, a man got something that a woman worked hard for. A noisy scourge will be unavoidable in the coming months. And a poll showed Americans have lost faith in power. So, the usual.
title: From a winningest coach to a losingest Oscar hopeful — it's the weekly news quiz

description: In Beirut's Shatila refugee camp, Palestinian refugees say they support Hamas' fight for their homeland.
title: War in Gaza opens scars for Palestinians in Lebanon, firming up support for Hamas

description: Nearly 1 in 5 Israeli casualties since the invasion of Gaza were caused by friendly fire or accidents. Experts say it's one of the highest such percentages in recent military history.
title: Friendly fire and accidents have killed a lot of Israeli soldiers in Gaza. Here's why

description: The "mob wife" look calls for flashy gold jewelry, big sunglasses — and fur coats. Some people are turning to vintage furs as a sustainable option, but critics say it isn't an ethical workaround.
title: The 'mob wife' aesthetic is in. But what about the vintage fur that comes with it?

description: The elections come as China, the U.S. and others wrangle for influence in the South Pacific region. Tuvalu is one of 12 countries that have official diplomatic relations with Taiwan.
title: Voting begins in tiny Tuvalu in election that reverberates from China to Australia

description: Kenneth Smith, 58, died at 8:25 pm Thursday night, after a slew of last minute appeals to several courts, including the U.S. Supreme Court, failed.
title: Alabama executes man by nitrogen gas for the first time in the U.S.

description: Seventy-two flights later, the small-but-mighty helicopter's time has come to an end after it was damaged during a test flight last week.
title: NASA retires Ingenuity, the little helicopter that made history on Mars
